title: Filipino Ribs Recipe
description: This Filipino ribs recipe simmers ribs in soy sauce, onions, and star anise, then finishes with a honey, ginger, lemon, soy Worcestershire sauce glaze.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Filipino Filipino Ribs 4.6 (84) 71 Reviews 14 Photos This Filipino ribs recipe glazes spareribs with the sweet, tangy taste of the Philippines. One of the honey coating ingredients, star anise, is native to China; it is a star-shaped, dark brown pod that contains a pea-sized seed in each of its eight segments. Star anise is available at all Asian markets as well as many general grocery stores. Submitted by CHRISTYJ Updated on February 5, 2025 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 1 hr 45 mins Total Time: 2 hrs Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 6 pounds pork spareribs 2 medium onions, cut into wedges 6 tablespoons soy sauce, divided 6 whole star anise pods ¼ teaspoon ground black pepper ½ cup water 1 tablespoon vegetable oil 1 medium onion, finely chopped ½ cup honey 2 tablespoons brown sugar 1 tablespoon grated fresh ginger 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce 1 tablespoon lemon juice Directions Place ribs, 2 onions cut into wedges, 4 tablespoons soy sauce, star anise pods, and black pepper in a large stock pot . Add water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low, cover, and simmer until ribs are tender when pierced, about 1 ¼ hours, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1 onion chopped; cook and stir until onion is soft. Stir in honey, brown sugar, remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce, ginger, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice; cook and stir until well blended. Remove from heat. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Remove ribs from stock pot using tongs; arrange in a single layer in an 11x16-inch baking pan. Brush evenly with honey glaze. Bake in the preheated oven, basting often with pan drippings, until ribs are well glazed, about 30 minutes. Recipe Tip Star anise is available at all Asian markets as well as many grocery stores. I Made It Print 830 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Filipino Ribs 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 14 Photo by  WannaBACook 04/02/2020 I love this recipe! A bit time consuming, but not difficult. Perfectly fun recipe now that I’m Covid-working from home. Did not have star anise on hand, but was still delicious! Kids and hubby loved it too. 03 of 14 Photo by  Tin Gayda 03/20/2020 04 of 14 Photo by  Ché 01/05/2017 05 of 14 Photo by  Taryn Renée 09/21/2016 06 of 14 Photo by  Lee Alexander 09/08/2016 07 of 14 Photo by  Faith Davidson 08/28/2016 08 of 14 Photo by  Steve G 08/23/2016 4 stars because I just prefer BBQ sauce. The ribs were different and good, though. Went well with Bush's beans and corn. 09 of 14 Photo by  Kimmy Brewer Asher 08/19/2016 This recipe is packed with flavor and was a huge hit with the family. I did add enough water to cover the ribs when boiled in stock pot. I also added a tbs of Chinese garlic chile sauce to the honey mixture in the pan. Will definitely make these again. 10 of 14 Photo by  Mariam Ejiro Kirby 08/18/2016 Delicious and easy to make. I made some modifications to the recipe, like added sriracha for a little heat. Turned out great! 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Singaporean Tender Pork Spare Ribs 31 Ratings Caribbean-Spiced Pork Side Ribs 39 Ratings Salt and Pepper Spare Ribs 46 Ratings Carolina Style Ribs 27 Ratings BBQ Country-Style Pork Ribs - Sous Vide 4 Ratings Drunken Ribs 15 Ratings Robin's Spicy Ribs 7 Ratings Cider-Mopped Spareribs Asian Style Country Ribs 222 Ratings Classic Barbecued Ribs 5 Ratings Strawberry Jalapeno Smoked Ribs 2 Ratings Swedish Spareribs 84 Ratings Slow Cooker Barbecued Ribs 17 Ratings Instant Pot Baby Back Ribs 237 Ratings Sweet Smoked Pork Ribs 143 Ratings Larry's Smoked BBQ Spare Ribs 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. Reduce heat to medium low, cover, and simmer until ribs are tender when pierced, about 1 ¼ hours, stirring occasionally.;Meanwhile, heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add 1 onion chopped; cook and stir until onion is soft. Stir in honey, brown sugar, remaining 2 tablespoons soy sauce, ginger, Worcestershire sauce, and lemon juice; cook and stir until well blended. Remove from heat.;Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).;Remove ribs from stock pot using tongs; arrange in a single layer in an 11x16-inch baking pan. Brush evenly with honey glaze.;Bake in the preheated oven, basting often with pan drippings, until ribs are well glazed, about 30 minutes.
